para.text: This topic describes where in ModelMuse you can set the various options in MODFLOW
The packages written to the name file is controlled by which packages have been activated in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The head and drawdown output is controlled in the
. The cell-by-cell flow file is controlled in the
. Externally generated files can be specified in the
In MODFLOW-LGR models, the LGR Control file data is specified in the
The comments and options in the Basic package are specified in the
. HNOFLOW is also specified on the
. The IBOUND array is specified using the Active data set. The STRT array is specified with the MODFLOW_Initial_Head data set. Data sets can be edited in the
. Another option for specifying the SRTR array is to specify an external binary file containing the initial heads on the
When starting a new MODFLOW, you can specify the grid in the
. The number of layers can be edited later in the
. Data sets for the elevations of the top of the model and the bottom of each layer group will be created. The values of these data sets can be specified in the
. There are numerous ways to edit the grid. See
for more details. The stress periods are specified in the
. The length and time units are specified on the
Multiplier and Zone arrays are used in conjunction with parameters in the LPF, UPW, HUF2, RCH, EVT, and ETS packages. The parameters are defined in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . For the LPF and UPW paakages, the user specifies whether multiplier or zone arrays will be used with a particular data set. If they are used, ew data sets will be created whose values can be specified in the
. For parameters in the HUF2, the user can specify which parameters apply to which hydrogeologic units in the

. For each parameter in each hydrogeologic unit, the user also specifies whether multiplier or zone arrays are used with it and, if so, data sets will be created to define the values of the data arrays. With the RCH, EVT, and ETS packages, Objects are used to specify where each parameter applies using the

. For these packages, the extent of an object that defines one of these parameters is used to define the zone array for the parameter and the values for the parameter for the object define the multiplier arrays. See also the
The parameter values associated with each parameter are defined in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . They also can be specified in the
The BCF package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . If Wetting is used, it is activated on the
. The layer properties are specified in the
. Data sets for the remaining data in the BCF package will be created with the BCF package is activated. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
The LPF package is activated on the
para.link: LPF: Layer Property Flow Package Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . If Wetting is used, it is activated on the
. The layer properties are specified in the
. Data sets for the remaining data in the LPF package will be created with the LPF package is activated. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The HUF2 package is activated on the
para.link: HUF2: Hydrogeologic Unit Flow Package Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . If Wetting is used, it is activated on the
. The Hydrogeologic units are defined in the
. The layer properties are specified in the
. Data sets for the remaining data in the HUF2 package will be created with the HUF2 package is activated or when hydrogeologic units are defined. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The UPw package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The layer properties are specified in the
. Data sets for the remaining data in the LPF package will be created with the LPF package is activated. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The HFB6 package is activated on the
para.link: HFB: Horizontal Flow Barrier Package Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The barriers are defined with polyline or polygon objects in the
para.link: HFB: Horizontal Flow Barrier Package Pane
para.text: . Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The UZF package is activated on the
para.link: UZF: Unsaturated Zone Flow Package Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . Data sets for UZF package will be created with the UZF package is activated. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
. Transient data for the UZF package is specified on the
The SWI2 package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . Data sets for SWI2 package will be created with the SWI2 package is activated. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
The Boundary Flow and Head package input file is created by MODFLOW-LGR to communicated between parent and child models. It is not created manually.
The CHD package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The specified head boundaries are specified on the
para.link: CHD: Time-Variant Specified Head Package Pane
para.text: . Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The FHB package is activated on the
para.link: FHB: Flow and Head Boundary Package Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The specified flow and head boundaries are specified on the
para.link: Flows in FHB: Flow and Head Boundary Package
Heads in FHB: Flow and Head Boundary Package

para.text: The FHB package is activated on the
para.link: FHB: Flow and Head Boundary Package Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The specified flow and head boundaries are specified on the
para.link: Flows in FHB: Flow and Head Boundary Package
Heads in FHB: Flow and Head Boundary Package

para.text: The RCH package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The recharge are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The WEL package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The wells are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The DRN package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The drains are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The DRT package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The drains are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The EVT package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The evapotranspiration data are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The ETS package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The evapotranspiration data are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The GHB package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The boundary data are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The LAK package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The lakes are specified with objects on the
. The user defines LKARR which corresponds to the Lakebed_Leakance data set in ModelMuse. The values of the data set can be specified in the
. The Lake_ID data set can be used for visualization purposes.
The MNW1 package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The multi-node wells data are specified with objects on the
The MNW2 package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The multi-node wells data are specified with objects on the
The RES package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The reservoirs are specified with objects on the
. The user define the Reservoir_Bed_Thickness, Reservoir_Elevations, and Reservoir_Hydraulic_Conductivity data sets in ModelMuse. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
. The Lake_ID data set can be used for visualization purposes.
The RIP package in MODFLOW-OWHM is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The reservoirs are specified with objects on the
. The user defines plant groups in the
para.link: Riparian ET Plant Groups dialog box

para.text: The RIV package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The rivers are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: The SFR package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The streams are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: can be used with the SFR package.
The STR package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The streams are specified with objects on the
. Parameters for this package can be edited in the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: can be used with the STR package.

toggle.caption: Solvers (DE4, GMG, PCG, PCGN, SIP, NWT)

para.text: All of the solvers are activated and fully specified in the of the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: Gages for Lakes and Streams are defined in the
. Defining one or more gages automatically activates the GAGE package.
The HYD package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The observation locations are specified with objects on the
The LMT package is activated by activating the BTN package in MT3D on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box

para.text: Information for MNWI package is specified on the
. If any such information is specified, the MNWI package is automatically activated.
Data for the OC option is specified in the
The SUB package is activated on the
para.link: SUB: Subsidence and Aquifer-System Compaction Package Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . Delay and No-Delay interbeds are defined in the
. Data sets related to the interbeds are automatically created when the delay or no-delay interbeds are created. The values of the data sets can be specified in the

toggle.caption: Subsidence and Aquifer-System Compaction Package for Water-Table Aquifers (SWT) package

para.text: The SWT package is activated on the
para.link: SWT: Subsidence and Aquifer-System Compaction Package for Water-Table Aquifers Pane
MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . Data sets related to the interbeds are automatically created when the interbeds are created. The values of the data sets can be specified in the
The HOB package is activated on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
para.text: . The head observations are specified with objects on the
. They may also be edited on the

toggle.caption: Flow Observations (CHOB, DROB, GBOB, RVOB, and STOB packages)

para.text: The flow observations packages are activated on the their respective panes on the
para.link: MODFLOW Packages and Programs dialog box
CHOB: Specified-Head Flow Observation Package Pane
para.text: ). The flow observations are first defined on the
. Once defined, individual objects can be included in a flow observation on the their respective panes on the
para.link: CHOB: Specified-Head Flow Observation Package Pane

para.text: Observation (OBS) Utility for a GWF Model
